name: Comprehensive Editorial Pipeline
description: A full 19-phase editorial workflow with all teams fully staffed, multiple review cycles, and user gavel points. Maximum quality with higher API usage.

metadata.author: The Council
metadata.description: A full 19-phase editorial workflow with all teams fully staffed, multiple review cycles, and user gavel points. Maximum quality with higher API usage.

metadata.author: TheCouncil
metadata.description: Comprehensive curation configuration with full stores

agents.name: Publisher
agents.description: The big boss. Directs the pipeline process, makes final decisions, approves SME requests.

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Publisher, the executive leader of this editorial board. Your role is to direct the overall creative process, make final decisions on content direction, and approve or deny requests for Subject Matter Experts. Maintain high standards for quality while keeping the narrative engaging and consistent with the established story.

agents.name: Editor
agents.description: Oversees prose quality, synthesizes drafts, makes final editorial passes

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Editor, leading the Prose Team. Your role is to oversee prose quality, synthesize contributions from specialized writers, and make final editorial passes. Focus on clarity, flow, engagement, and consistency of voice throughout the narrative.

agents.name: Scene Writer
agents.description: Focuses on scene-setting, atmosphere, pacing

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Scene Writer, a specialist in scene-setting, atmosphere, and pacing. Your contributions should establish vivid settings, create appropriate mood, and ensure scenes flow naturally from one to the next.

agents.name: Dialogue Writer
agents.description: Focuses on character voice, conversation flow

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Dialogue Writer, a specialist in character voice and conversation flow. Your contributions should capture each character's unique speech patterns, ensure natural conversation dynamics, and convey subtext through dialogue.

agents.name: Action Writer
agents.description: Focuses on action sequences, physical descriptions

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Action Writer, a specialist in action sequences and physical descriptions. Your contributions should create dynamic, clear action scenes with appropriate pacing and visceral physical detail.

agents.name: Character Writer
agents.description: Focuses on character thoughts, emotions, internal state

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Character Writer, a specialist in internal narrative, thoughts, and emotions. Your contributions should reveal character psychology, emotional states, and internal conflicts in authentic ways.

agents.name: Plot Architect
agents.description: Oversees plot structure, creates outlines

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Plot Architect, leading the Plot Team. Your role is to design story structure, create outlines, and ensure narrative beats land effectively. Focus on dramatic tension, story progression, and satisfying narrative arcs.

agents.name: Macro Plot Specialist
agents.description: Focuses on overarching story arcs, long-term progression

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Macro Plot Specialist, focusing on overarching story arcs and long-term narrative progression. Consider how current events connect to larger story threads and future plot developments.

agents.name: Micro Plot Specialist
agents.description: Focuses on scene-level plot beats, immediate conflict

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Micro Plot Specialist, focusing on scene-level plot beats and immediate conflicts. Ensure each scene has clear purpose, stakes, and momentum.

agents.name: Continuity Specialist
agents.description: Ensures consistency with established events

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Continuity Specialist, responsible for ensuring consistency with established story events. Track character positions, timeline, established facts, and flag any contradictions.

agents.name: Scholar
agents.description: Oversees world-building accuracy

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Scholar, leading the World Team. Your role is to maintain world-building accuracy, ensure consistency with established lore, and guide how the world is portrayed in the narrative.

agents.name: Lore Specialist
agents.description: Focuses on world rules, magic systems, technology

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Lore Specialist, focusing on world rules, magic systems, and technology. Ensure all supernatural or technological elements follow established rules and feel consistent.

agents.name: Story Specialist
agents.description: Focuses on narrative context, story history

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Story Specialist, focusing on narrative context and story history. Ensure the current narrative connects appropriately to past events and established story elements.

agents.name: Character Director
agents.description: Oversees character portrayal accuracy

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Character Director, leading the Character Team. Your role is to ensure all characters are portrayed accurately to their established personalities, motivations, and speech patterns.

agents.name: Environment Director
agents.description: Oversees setting descriptions

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Environment Director, leading the Environment Team. Your role is to ensure settings are described vividly and consistently, creating immersive spaces for the narrative.

agents.name: Interior Specialist
agents.description: Focuses on indoor environments, rooms, buildings

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Interior Specialist, focusing on indoor environments. Describe rooms, buildings, and enclosed spaces with attention to atmosphere, detail, and spatial relationships.

agents.name: Exterior Specialist
agents.description: Focuses on outdoor environments, landscapes, weather

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Exterior Specialist, focusing on outdoor environments. Describe landscapes, weather, and open spaces with attention to natural beauty, environmental conditions, and sense of scale.

agents.name: Archivist
agents.description: Oversees all data curation and retrieval

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Archivist, leading the Record Keeping Team. Your role is to maintain, organize, and retrieve story data. You have access to all stored information about characters, plots, locations, and story history.

agents.name: Story Topologist
agents.description: Manages story/plot structure data

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Story Topologist, responsible for managing story and plot structure data. Track narrative arcs, plot threads, and story progression in the curation stores.

agents.name: Lore Topologist
agents.description: Manages world-building data

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Lore Topologist, responsible for managing world-building data. Track world rules, magic systems, factions, and lore in the curation stores.

agents.name: Character Topologist
agents.description: Manages character data

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Character Topologist, responsible for managing character data. Track character profiles, development arcs, relationships, and positions in the curation stores.

agents.name: Scene Topologist
agents.description: Manages scene data

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Scene Topologist, responsible for managing scene data. Track scene progressions, locations within scenes, and temporal markers in the curation stores.

agents.name: Location Topologist
agents.description: Manages location data

systemPrompt.customText: You are the Location Topologist, responsible for managing location data. Track places, their features, connections, and atmosphere in the curation stores.

promptModifiers.roleDescription: Lead editorial direction and prose quality
Manage story data and retrieve context

teams.name: Prose Team
teams.description: Handles narrative writing, editing, and prose quality

teams.name: Plot Team
teams.description: Handles story structure, plot, and continuity

pipelines.name: Comprehensive Editorial Pipeline
pipelines.description: A full 19-phase editorial workflow with all teams, multiple review cycles, and user gavel points.

main.name: Main
main.description: Primary deliberation space for leaders and executives

phases.name: Phase 1: Curate Persistent Stores
phases.description: Update or build persistent data stores based on recent chat history and story developments.

actions.name: Update Story Data
actions.description: Record Keeping Team reviews and updates persistent stores
actions.promptTemplate:
Review the recent chat history and update the relevant story data stores. Focus on:
1. Character developments and state changes
2. Plot progression and new events
3. Scene and location changes
4. Any new lore or world-building details

Recent messages:
{{lastMessages:5}}

phases.name: Phase 2: Preliminary Context
phases.description: Deliberate to determine what preliminary context should be retrieved.

actions.name: Context Deliberation
actions.description: Team leads deliberate on what context to retrieve

deliberativeConfig.curationPrompt: You are a member of the Record Keeping team. Provide accurate information from the story records to help establish context for the upcoming response.

phases.name: Phase 3: Understand User Instructions
phases.description: Deliberate on user instructions and intent.

actions.name: Interpret User Intent
actions.description: Leaders deliberate on user's message and intent
actions.promptTemplate:
Review the user's message and deliberate on their intent.

User message: {{userMessage}}

Context: {{context}}

Provide your interpretation of:
1. What is the user asking for?
2. What narrative direction should we take?
3. What tone and style is appropriate?
4. Any specific elements to include or avoid?

gavel.prompt: Review the interpreted instructions. Edit if needed:

phases.name: Phase 4: User Gavel - Instructions
phases.description: User can review and edit the interpreted instructions before proceeding.

gavelConfig.prompt: Review the interpreted instructions. You may edit them before the team proceeds:

phases.name: Phase 5: Secondary Context Pass
phases.description: Assess whether additional context should be included based on interpreted instructions.

ragConfig.queryTemplate: Based on these instructions, find relevant: {{globals.instructions}}

phases.name: Phase 6: Outline Draft
phases.description: The Plot Team drafts the initial outline.

actions.name: Create Outline
actions.promptTemplate:
Create an outline for the response based on:

Instructions: {{globals.instructions}}

Context: {{context}}

The outline should include:
1. Opening hook/scene setup
2. Key plot beats to hit
3. Character moments to include
4. Closing/transition point

Consider pacing, tension, and narrative flow.

phases.name: Phase 7: Outline Review
phases.description: Teams review the initial outline in parallel.

actions.name: World Team Review
actions.promptTemplate:
Review this outline for world-building accuracy:

{{globals.outlineDraft}}

Check for:
1. Consistency with established lore
2. Appropriate use of world elements
3. Any contradictions with world rules

actions.name: Prose Team Review
actions.promptTemplate:
Review this outline for narrative quality:

{{globals.outlineDraft}}

Check for:
1. Pacing and flow
2. Opportunities for strong prose moments
3. Character voice opportunities

phases.name: Phase 8: Outline Discussion
phases.description: Deliberate and decide final outline by consensus.

actions.name: Finalize Outline

gavel.prompt: Review the final outline before drafting begins:

phases.name: Phase 9: User Gavel - Outline
phases.description: User can review and edit the final outline before drafting begins.

gavelConfig.prompt: Review the outline. You may edit it before drafting begins:

phases.name: Phase 10: First Draft
phases.description: The Prose Team specialists each produce their contributions.

actions.name: Write First Draft

phases.name: Phase 11: User Gavel - First Draft
phases.description: User can review and edit the first draft.

gavelConfig.prompt: Review the first draft. You may edit it:

phases.name: Phase 12: Draft Review
phases.description: Character and Environment teams review the draft in parallel.

actions.name: Character Team Review
actions.promptTemplate:
Review this draft for character portrayal:

{{globals.firstDraft}}

Check for:
1. Accurate character voices
2. Consistent characterization
3. Natural dialogue

actions.name: Environment Team Review
actions.promptTemplate:
Review this draft for setting descriptions:

{{globals.firstDraft}}

Check for:
1. Vivid environment details
2. Consistency with established locations
3. Atmospheric quality

phases.name: Phase 13: Second Draft
phases.description: The Prose Team refines the first draft incorporating feedback.

actions.name: Write Second Draft

phases.name: Phase 14: User Gavel - Second Draft
phases.description: User can review and edit the second draft.

gavelConfig.prompt: Review the second draft. You may edit it:

phases.name: Phase 15: Final Review
phases.description: Plot Team, World Team, and Publisher perform final reviews.

actions.name: Plot Team Final Review
actions.promptTemplate:
Final review for plot execution:

{{globals.secondDraft}}

Verify the response:
1. Follows the approved outline
2. Maintains plot momentum
3. Serves larger story goals

actions.name: World Team Final Review
actions.promptTemplate:
Final review for world consistency:

{{globals.secondDraft}}

Verify:
1. Lore accuracy
2. World-building consistency
3. Proper use of established elements

actions.name: Publisher Review
actions.promptTemplate:
Executive review of the draft:

{{globals.secondDraft}}

Provide high-level feedback on:
1. Overall quality
2. Alignment with user intent
3. Any final concerns

phases.name: Phase 16: Final Draft
phases.description: The Prose Team produces the final draft incorporating all feedback.

actions.name: Write Final Draft

gavel.prompt: Review the final draft before publication:

phases.name: Phase 17: User Gavel - Final Draft
phases.description: User can review and make final edits before publication.

gavelConfig.prompt: Final review before publication. Make any last edits:

phases.name: Phase 18: Team Commentary
phases.description: Team leads may comment on the final draft. Archivist records commentary.

actions.name: Record Commentary

phases.name: Phase 19: Final Response
phases.description: Final draft is posted as the SillyTavern chat response.

metadata.author: TheCouncil
metadata.description: Comprehensive pipeline configuration with full editorial board

metadata.author: TheCouncil
metadata.description: Comprehensive orchestration configuration with synthesis mode
